summary: The Full-Year Continuing Appropriations and Extensions Act, 2025, extends funding and makes adjustments to various federal programs. It covers areas such as agriculture, defense, energy, healthcare (including Medicare and telehealth), human services, and homeland security. The bill includes extensions for community health centers, special diabetes programs, and various Medicare provisions. It also addresses topics like cybersecurity, commodity futures, and disaster relief. The full text also contains amendments to existing laws related to funding levels and authorization dates for multiple departments and programs.
